revealed_symptoms.hyperkeratosis: There's this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels.
revealed_symptoms.color variation: It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.
revealed_symptoms.diameter >6mm: It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing.
revealed_symptoms.telangiectasia: There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before.
revealed_symptoms.pruritus: It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin.
revealed_symptoms.shiny or waxy bump: It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away.
revealed_symptoms.rapid growth: I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks.
revealed_symptoms.spontaneous bleeding: Sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.

hidden_symptoms.ulceration: It’s like a cut or sore that just won’t heal, and sometimes it scabs over but comes right back.
hidden_symptoms.border irregularity: The edges are all jagged, kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
hidden_symptoms.asymmetry: One side of this mole looks different from the other, like it's lopsided or uneven.
hidden_symptoms.erythema: The skin around it looks red or puffy, like it’s irritated or reacting to something.

patient_history.content: Hi, I'll be your doctor today. What brings you in?

Well, I have this rough, flaky spot that won’t go away, and sometimes it peels. It’s got a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in. It’s bigger than the eraser on a pencil, and I feel like it’s still growing. There are these tiny, spidery red blood vessels around the spot that I didn’t notice before. It’s super itchy sometimes, or feels kind of tingly, like a weird sensation under my skin. It looks kinda like a smooth, shiny pimple, but it never pops or goes away. I swear this mole or bump got bigger really fast, like in just a few weeks. And sometimes this spot just starts bleeding out of nowhere, even if I don’t touch it.

Thank you for providing such a detailed description. I would like to ask a few more questions about the spot. How long have you noticed this spot or lesion on your skin? Has anyone in your family ever had skin cancer?
I’ve noticed this spot for a few months now, maybe longer. As for my family, I don't know of anyone who's had skin cancer.
Thank you. Can you tell me about your history of sun exposure? Do you regularly spend time in the sun, use tanning beds, or have you had any severe sunburns in the past?
I work outdoors, so I get a lot of sun. I haven't used tanning beds, but I've definitely had my share of bad sunburns when I was younger.
Thank you. To better understand the spot, could you tell me more about its borders? Are the edges of the spot smooth, notched, or irregular?
I'm not sure what you mean by 'notched,' but the edges are kinda messy, not smooth like my other moles.
Thank you. Does the spot appear to be larger than a pencil eraser, or about 6 millimeters in diameter? Have you noticed any other changes in the spot's size, shape, or color recently?
Yes, it's definitely bigger than a pencil eraser, and I feel like it's still growing. It has a bunch of different colors—like brown, black, maybe even some red or blue mixed in.
